title: A Prospective, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Phase 2 Efficacy and Safety Study of Oral ELND005 for Treatment of Agitation and Aggression in Patients With Moderate to Severe Alzheimer's Disease
description_brief: The primary purpose of this study is to determine whether ELND005 is effective in treating symptoms of agitation and aggression in patients with Alzheimer's disease

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in NPI-C Combined Agitation and Aggression Subscores (NPI-C A+A).
outcomeMeasures.description: The NPI-C (de Medeiros et al 2010) is a validated and reliable behavioral measure that assesses psychopathology in dementia subjects. It evaluates 14 neuropsychiatric disturbances common in dementia.Higher scores on the NPI-C are associated with a greater clinical severity of symptoms. The NPI-C Agitation and Aggression score ranges from 0-63. The analysis of the NPI-C A+A score was performed on the mITT population.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Modified-ADCS-CGIC Agitation Scores
outcomeMeasures.description: The Alzheimer's Disease Cooperative Study-Clinical Global Impression of Change (ADCS-CGIC) is a widely used scale for the global assessment of change in AD trials.It is a 7-point Likert scale that ranges from marked improvement scored as 1 to marked worsening scored as 7, with no change scored as 4. The range is from 1 to 7. Higher scores indicate worsening agitation.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: mITT population with available data for Modified-ADCS-CGIC Agitation Scores

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in NPI Total Scores
outcomeMeasures.description: The NPI (Cummings et al 1994) is a behavioral measure that assesses psychopathology in dementia subjects. It evaluates 12 neuropsychiatric disturbances common in dementia: delusions, hallucinations, agitation/aggression, dysphoria, anxiety, apathy, irritability, euphoria, disinhibition, aberrant motor behavior, nighttime behavior disturbances, and appetite and eating abnormalities. Higher scores on the NPI are associated with greater frequency and severity of symptoms. The scale range is 0-144.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: mITT population with available data for NPI Total Scores

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in MMSE Scores
outcomeMeasures.description: The Mini-Mental State Exam (MMSE) (Folstein et al 1975) is a brief cognitive test assessing general cognitive function that has been employed in numerous clinical trials of products approved for the treatment of AD. The score can range from 0 to 30, with lower scores indicating greater impairment in function.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: mITT population with available data for MMSE Scores

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in ADCS-ADL Scores
outcomeMeasures.description: The Alzheimer's Disease Cooperative Study-Activities of Daily Living (ADCS-ADL) (Galasko et al 1997) is a functional assessment that measures instrumental and basic activities of daily living. The total score for the 23-item ADCS-ADL ranges from 0 to 78 points, with lower scores indicating greater impairment in function.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: mITT population with available data for ADCS-ADL Scores

drug: ELND005 (scyllo‑inositol) — oral small molecule, described as an amyloid anti‑aggregation agent
explanation_target: Reason: The trial title and primary purpose state the study is testing ELND005 for treatment of agitation and aggression in patients with moderate–severe Alzheimer’s disease (i.e., a neuropsychiatric/symptom‑management aim).

Act: ELND005 is scyllo‑inositol, an endogenous inositol stereoisomer developed as an oral amyloid anti‑aggregation agent (a small molecule). Evidence: phase 2 randomized trial and summaries identify ELND005 = scyllo‑inositol and describe it as an oral amyloid anti‑aggregation agent. citeturn0search0turn0search1

Web search results (selected): PubMed/Neurology phase 2 report: 'A phase 2 randomized trial of ELND005, scyllo‑inositol, in mild to moderate Alzheimer disease' (reports ELND005 = scyllo‑inositol, oral amyloid anti‑aggregation agent). citeturn0search0turn0search1 Pharmacokinetics study: 'Pharmacokinetic Profile of Orally Administered Scyllo‑Inositol (Elnd005)…' shows oral administration and CSF/brain penetration. citeturn0search6 Neurology supplement/abstract reporting effects on emergence of neuropsychiatric symptoms in the phase 2 study. citeturn0search2

Reflect: Classification rationale — although ELND005 is a disease‑targeted small molecule (amyloid anti‑aggregation), this specific trial’s stated primary purpose is to treat agitation and aggression (neuropsychiatric symptoms). Therefore the appropriate category for this trial is 'neuropsychiatric symptom improvement'. Note ambiguity: one could also describe the drug itself as a disease‑targeted small molecule, but classification here follows the trial’s intended clinical effect (symptom management).
explanation_agent: Reason: The investigational drug ELND005 (scyllo‑inositol) is described and reported in the literature as an oral amyloid anti‑aggregation small molecule, so the drug’s biological action is directed at amyloid beta aggregation/clearance. citeturn0search0turn0search2

Act: Extracted details — drug: ELND005 (scyllo‑inositol); mechanism: amyloid anti‑aggregation; trial: Phase 2, randomized, placebo‑controlled testing ELND005 for neuropsychiatric symptoms (agitation/aggression) in mild–moderate to moderate–severe AD. Key sources: PubMed/Neurology phase‑2 report and conference abstract. citeturn0search0turn0search1turn0search2

Reflect: Although this particular study’s primary clinical aim was symptom management (agitation/aggression), the compound’s mechanism targets amyloid aggregation — therefore the most specific CADRO classification is A) Amyloid beta. I considered symptom‑management framing but classified by the drug’s biological target per CADRO guidance. citeturn0search1turn0search0

Web search results cited: PubMed phase‑2 report: 'A phase 2 randomized trial of ELND005, scyllo‑inositol, in mild to moderate Alzheimer disease' (describes ELND005 as an oral amyloid anti‑aggregation agent and reports CSF/biomarker effects). citeturn0search0; Neurology phase‑2 article/entry (full article/abstract) confirming trial design and amyloid anti‑aggregation description. citeturn0search2; Neurology supplement/abstract reporting effects on emergence of neuropsychiatric symptoms in the phase‑2 study. citeturn0search1
